page.title: 04NATURE CONSERVATION
page.content: The Somerset Trust for Nature Conservation exists to save animals and plants which are in danger. There are many trees such as Sweet Chestnut tree and Horse Chestnut tree and there are animals such as badgers, frogs, toads, drakes and bats. The Quantock Hills are designated as an area of outstanding natural beauty and so the Trust has made Fyne Court as an interptetation centre with nature trails designed to contribute towards the understanding of the wildlife of the Quantocks and the problems of their conservation. The junior section of the Trust includes the Badger Club for primary school children. The Trust employs two full-time conservation officers based at Fyne Court.
